title: Best design principles / color theory / aesthetics book recommendations
content:
Hi all,

Just wondering if anyone can recommend me any top end design principles, color theory and aesthetics books.

I know Paul Rand was always on about making sure you study aesthetics.

Any books relating back to the graphic design field on these topics would be great.

I've been doing design work for about 10 years but never had any formal education.
author: TF22Raptor

comments.content:
For basic understanding of aesthetics, I'd really recommend:  
- "Grid Systems in Graphic Design" by [Josef MÃ¼ller-Brockmann](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201153134/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Josef_M%C3%BCller-Brockmann).  
- "The New Typography" by [Jan Tschichold](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201153134/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jan_Tschichold).

Not merely about aesthetic, but I think this [list](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201153134/http:/www.underconsideration.com/speakup/archives/002514.html) might interest you too.
